results.title: Bali today
results.brief_description: Illustrates life on the small volcanic island of Bali in Indonesia. Emphasises the role of the Brahmin religion in everyday life, with scenes of the rice harvest, colourful dance ceremonies, and flower offerings to the gods. Examples of weaving and mask-making illustrates Balinese art. No other credits available.

results.title: Balada O Podravini
results.brief_description: A big, featherless bird helps us discover Podravina and its inhabitants. It is autumn, the crops are in, and we are invited to a country fair and a funeral. We understand how the peasants approach life and the world around them through this animated film.

results.title: Baking unleavened bread: Pushtu Nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Reveals the simple but physically demanding life of the nomadic Pushtu. Shows a Pushtu wife skilfully fashioning large flat discs of dough and baking each separately by pressing it into the convex side of a great copper pan. Suitable for Upper Primary-Middle Secondary students.

results.title: Bakery beat
results.brief_description: Gives a step-by-step account of the making of bread, using many close-ups and showing the comparison between a small two man bakery and a large automated one. This film is non-narrated with a music soundtrack and is applicable to themes of interdependence and social organization. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bakerman
results.brief_description: Directed and shot by Lars Von Trier, this one-take music video features the artists from Danish electro group Laid Back playing their instruments while sky-diving.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.title: Bail up! The Bushranger on Australia's silent screen (1906-1928)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This is a selection of fragments and scenes from the only known surviving silent titles of Australias bushranger films which, in the silent years of our cinema, were both prolific and popular. They were a distinctive genre and a significant part of our cultural heritage. But by 1912, censorship bans, provoked by ideas of law and order and morality, effectively robbed Australian moviegoers of a national screen identity. We were then to be culturally colonised by the Hollywood cowboy. This video contains selections from the only known surviving silent narrative titles: Kelly Gang 1906 ; The Story of the Kelly Gang 1906 and 1910 re-release ; Thunderbolt 1910 ; Trooper Campbell 1914 ; The Kelly Gang 1920 ; Robbery under arms 1920 ; When the Kellys were out 1923 ; Trooper OBrien 1928.

results.title: Bags of life
results.brief_description: A treatment of the research that has been undertaken into the area of cell membranes. The characteristics of cell membranes and the possible chemical structures are looked at. Suitable for Upper Secondary students

results.title: Badminton fundamentals
results.brief_description: This films intorduces the novuice to the basic rules of the increasingly popular sport of badminton. Illustrates what is needed to play the game, from the court used to the racquets and shuttlecocks and suggested attire (for the 1950s). It also demonstrates the rules of the game, how to play; handgrips, the various strokes and stances and tips for playing better.

results.title: Badminton for Beginners
results.brief_description: A guide to the basic strokes recommended by the Western Australian Badminton Association. This video is designed for both coaches of badminton, and for players new to the game. It clearly demonstrates and explains the fundamentals of stroke production, footwork and court movement.
